thread.title: Arriving to empty streets in evacuated Oroville
thread.title_full: Arriving to empty streets in evacuated Oroville

title: Arriving to empty streets in evacuated Oroville
text:
Live updates: Evacuations ordered below Oroville Dam Feb. 12, 2017, 7:56 p.m. 
"This is not a Drill. Repeat this is not a drill,” the National Weather Service said Sunday, urging people living below Oroville Dam to evacuate. The evacuation was ordered because of a “hazardous situation” involving the Northern California dam's emergency spillway. The National Weather Service said the auxiliary spillway is expected to fail and could send an “uncontrolled release of flood waters from Lake Oroville.” Feb. 12, 2017, 8:05 p.m. Evacuated Oroville is a ghost town 
Times reporter Chris Megerian described Oroville as a ghost town when he reached the area Sunday night. He described the scene on Twitter. Latest updates
